site_description: A comprehensive hyper-converged cloud infrastructure management platform for deploying and managing databases, applications, storage, and virtual machines.
error_message_400: Oops! That request looks a bit wonky. Mind double-checking your input?
error_message_401: Hold up! You'll need to show your digital ID to enter this exclusive club.
error_message_403: Sorry, this area is VIP only! You don't have the golden ticket for this resource.
error_message_404: Well, this is awkward... The page seems to have gone on vacation without telling us!
error_message_500: Yikes! Our servers are having a moment. Please give us a sec to get things back on track.
error_message_501: Sorry! This feature is still on the engineers' to-do list and hasn't been implemented yet. We'll get them a cup of coffee to hurry it along.
error_message_502: Our gateway is feeling a bit under the weather. We're nursing it back to health!
error_message_503: We're temporarily out of order, like a vending machine that ate your dollar. Try again soon!
compute_dashboard_description: Monitor and manage your compute resources including virtual machines and GPUs.
no_model_artifact_guide: No local models found. Please download a model artifact to continue.
model_artifact_setting_description: Easily download model artifacts directly from Hugging Face for seamless integration and deployment. Access pre-trained models, manage versions, and streamline your workflow with secure, one-click downloads.
model_reference_hint: View model configuration and information below
models_description: AI models for intelligent data processing and analysis
databases_description: Relational and NoSQL databases for structured and flexible data storage
applications_description: Kubernetes applications with integrated app store
extensions_alert_description: One or more essential extensions are absent or not operating correctly. To restore full functionality, install the missing plugins using the button below.
extensions_metrics_bundle_description: Enable core extensions (monitoring, logging, and telemetry) to provide health visibility, alerting, metrics collection, and diagnostics for orchestrator components.
extensions_service_mesh_bundle_descripti: Deploy service mesh plugins to facilitate secure service-to-service communication, traffic management, and observability within microservices architectures.
extensions_registry_bundle_description: Configure container registry integration plugins to facilitate secure image storage, retrieval, and management for containerized applications.
extensions_model_bundle_description: Provision advanced model-related plugins — including GPU acceleration, distributed scheduling, and model lifecycle management — to optimize resource utilization and inference performance.
extensions_virtual_machine_bundle_descri: Provide virtual machine integration plugins that automate VM provisioning, lifecycle, networking, and connectivity for mixed workloads and legacy integrations.
extensions_storage_bundle_description: Integrate storage backends (NFS, object stores) to enable persistent volumes, efficient data access patterns, and scalable storage policies for workloads.
storage_description: Ceph with NFS, S3, and block storage capabilities
smb_share_name_constraint: Must not start with a number and be at most 10 characters long.
browsable_description: Allow this share to be visible in network browsing and share enumeration.
read_only_description: Prevent write operations to this share. Users can only read and download files.
guest_accessible_description: Allow anonymous guest access without authentication credentials.
map_to_guest_help: Configure authentication failure handling and guest access behavior.
map_to_guest_bad_user_info: Map to guest when username is incorrect
map_to_guest_bad_password_info: Map to guest when password is incorrect
configuration_description: These settings apply to all scopes. Review changes before applying.
settings_description: These settings apply to specific scope {scope}. Review changes before applying.
community_tier_name: Simple and User-Friendly Application and Storage Platform
community_tier_description: Designed for easy installation to enable application and storage platform.
premium_tier_name: Robust Storage Cluster with Advanced Distributed Architecture
premium_tier_description: Perfect for setting up a resilient and scalable storage cluster, supporting distributed architecture and high availability.
enterprise_tier_name: Enterprise-Grade Multi-Node Application and Storage Platform
enterprise_tier_description: Ideal for deploying an extensible application platform and storage cluster, supporting multi-node scalability, high availability, and enterprise-level features.
migrating_description: This functionality is being migrated to our new interface and will be available shortly.
under_development_description: Our elves are working their magic!
scope_selector_description: Please select your scope from the following:
create_scope_description: Organize users into groups with specific permissions. Resources are isolated between scopes.
create_scope_prefix_name_description: Prefix for node naming (defaults to scope name if not provided)
scope_not_found_redirect: Scope  '{invalid_scope}' does not exist, redirected to default scope '{scope}'
home_integration_description: Connect seamlessly with popular platforms and services to enhance your workflow.
setup_environment_curl_description: Copy the following command and execute it on the computer you want to use as the control node.
setup_environment_complete_description: Click the button below to go to your new environment.
setup_scope_configured_description: Your scope is already configured with the following facilities:
setup_scope_not_configured_description: Choose your plan below to get started.
create_scope_name_description: Enter a unique identifier for your scope and prefix for facility naming.
create_scope_name_invalid_format: Name must start with a lowercase letter and contain only lowercase letters and '-'.
create_scope_name_already_exists: This scope name already exists. Please choose a different name.
create_scope_machine_description: Choose a machine for your Ceph and Kubernetes deployment.
create_scope_storage_devices_description: Configure dedicated storage devices for Ceph.
create_scope_storage_devices_required: Please select at least one storage device.
create_scope_calico_cidr_description: Network range for Kubernetes pod communication.
create_scope_virtual_ip_description: High availability IP for Kubernetes control plane.
name: Name
store_description: Browse and install verified applications for your cluster.
edit_release_configuration_documentation: For more information, view the chart {documentation}
edit_release_configuration_hint: The provided values serve as overrides to the default settings. For further details, please refer to the {documentation}
deletion_warning: Please type the {identifier} exactly to confirm deletion. This action cannot be undone.
pool_replicated_size_direction: Size of 1 means no replication. Replicated size includes the original object.
pool_quota_size_direction: Set to 0 or leave blank to disable. Valid quota must be > 0.
pool_quota_objects_direction: Set to 0 or leave blank to disable. Valid quota must be > 0.
pool_erasure_limit_direction: Erasure (EC) requires at least 2 hosts and at least 3 OSDs (e.g. 2+1). If you only have one host, EC cannot provide host-level redundancy.
layering_description: Allows the creation of snapshots and clones of an image.
exclusive_lock_description: Ensures that only one client can write to the image at a time.
object_map_description: Tracks object existence to speed up image operations.
fast_diff_description: Speeds up the process of comparing two images.
deep_flatten_description: Removes clone dependency on parent image for faster deletion.
nfs_quota_size_direction: The size of the subvolume is specified by setting a quota on it. If left blank or put 0, then quota will be infinite.
user_suspended_direction: System user S3 key Auto-generate key User quota Enabled Bucket quota Enabled Suspending the user disables the user and subuser.
create_users_empty_warning: There is no user. Please add users from the following.
setting_boot_image_description: Boot images are operating system files used for machine deployment. These images can be configured with different architectures and distribution series, and can be set as default for automatic deployment of machines.
setting_machine_tag_description: Tags are identifiable labels that can be assigned to machines for filtering and group management. These tags help in organizing and managing machines based on their characteristics or purposes.
setting_ntp_server_description: NTP servers, specified as IP addresses or hostnames delimited by commas and/or spaces, to be used as time references for MAAS itself, the machines MAAS deploys, and devices that make use of MAAS's DHCP services.
setting_package_repository_description: Package repositories contain software packages that can be installed on machines. These repositories can be configured with custom URLs and enabled/disabled as needed to control software sources and updates for your infrastructure.
setting_single_sign_on_description: Single Sign-On (SSO) allows users to access multiple applications with one set of credentials. Configure your SSO provider details here to enable centralized authentication across your infrastructure management system.
single_sign_on_form_description: Set up your OpenID Connect provider configuration
networking_dashboard_description: Overview of network metrics including discovery status, DHCP, available IPs, DNS servers, device usage by month, and daily network traffic. Data is filtered by subnet and FQDN where applicable.
storage_dashboard_description: Monitor Ceph storage cluster performance, capacity usage, health status, OSD distribution, and throughput analytics. View real-time metrics for cluster health, capacity trends, and storage operations.
machine_dashboard_description: Overview of machine resources, usage trends, and analytics for the selected scope.
machine_dashboard_total_cpu_tooltip: Total number of CPU cores across all machines.
machine_dashboard_total_memory_tooltip: Total amount of memory across all machines.
machine_dashboard_total_storage_tooltip: Total storage capacity across all machines, including both used and available disk space, but excluding boot disks.
machine_dashboard_nodes_tooltip: Shows the monthly trend of node count over the past 6 months.
machine_dashboard_system_loads_tooltip: System load represents the average number of processes waiting for CPU time over 1 and 5 minute intervals. Higher values may indicate resource contention or heavy workload on your machines.
node_distribution_description: Shows the proportion of physical and virtual machines in your environment.
management_dashboard_description: Monitor your Kubernetes cluster's health, resource usage, and analytics. View real-time metrics for control plane, worker nodes, pods, containers, CPU, memory, vGPU, network, and storage throughput.
vgpu_usage_description: Displays the top 10 current GPU allocations and usage
vm_bus_type_direction: The communication protocol and physical interface used for connecting devices within a virtual machine.
clone_virtual_machine_name_direction: Name for the new virtual machine.
clone_virtual_machine_namespace_directio: Namespace for the new virtual machine.
machine_dashboard_gpu_memory_tooltip: Total GPU memory across all machines.
llm_dashboard_description: Provides real-time insights into model performance, including end-to-end latency and time to first token.
llm_dashboard_models_tooltip: Number of models and available pods.
llm_dashboard_requests_tooltip: Shows the 95th and 99th percentile request latency over the past 24 hours.
llm_dashboard_throughputs_tooltip: Displays prompt and generation token throughput for the last 24 hours.
llm_dashboard_time_to_first_token_toolti: Shows the 95th and 99th percentile time to first token for requests over the past 24 hours.
llm_alert_description: To use Large Language Model features, please install the required infrastructure in your Kubernetes cluster.
setting_data_volume_description: Virtual machine data volumes provide persistent storage for virtual machines and can be configured with different source types, capacities, and boot configurations.
setting_instance_type_description: Instance types define the hardware resources (CPU, memory, storage, etc.) allocated to virtual machines. Configure available instance types to match your workload requirements.
models_store_description: Browse and select from available Hugging Face models.
no_models_matching_filters: There are no models matching the selected filters.
push_image_description: Push an image to a project.
push_chart_description: Push a chart to a project.
gpu_relation_description: Displays the relationship between Machines, GPUs, and Pods for this model.
gpu_relation_guide_description: Interact with the graph to explore connections and allocations.
model_testing_description: Type a prompt below and press Send to test the model.
model_response_error: Oops! Something went wrong while fetching the response. Please try again or check your network connection.
health_check_statment: Are you alive? Please respond if you can process this message.
model_testing_init: Welcome! I'm your AI assistant. How can I help you today?
trouble_pushing_image_step_one: 1. Locate or Create {daemon} and Add or Edit {insecure_registries}
trouble_pushing_image_step_one_details: Add or update the {insecure_registries} array in your {daemon} file (typically located at {path} on Linux) to include the registry address:
trouble_pushing_image_step_two_details: To restart the Docker daemon on Linux, run the following commands:
install_extensions_description: Are you sure you want to install {extensionsBundle} extensions?
upgrade_extensions_description: Are you sure you want to upgrade {extensionsBundle} extensions?
validate_rfc1123: Must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters, '-' or '.', and must start and end with an alphanumeric character.
validate_alphanum_dash: Must consist of alphanumeric characters or '-'.
validate_lower_alphanum_dash: Must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters or '-'.
validate_alphanum_dash_start_alpha: Must consist of alphanumeric characters or '-', and start with a letter.
validate_lower_alphanum_dash_start_alpha: Must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters or '-', and start with a letter.
validate_lower_alphanum_dash_dot: Must consist of lower case alphanumeric characters, '-' or '.', and can start with '.'.
validate_max_length: Must be at most {max} characters long.
console_description: Please select a cluster from the top-right menu to view your workspace dashboard.
console_guide_cluster_description: Start here by selecting your target Cluster environment to initialize the dashboard.
console_guide_workspace_description: Once a cluster is selected, use this dropdown to navigate between different Workspaces.
console_guide_sidebar_description: Access all core features and navigate through the platform using this sidebar.
k8s_overview_description: Monitor your Kubernetes cluster status and resources
cluster_dashboard_node_description: Displays the total number of nodes in the cluster.
cluster_dashboard_power_usage_descriptio: Displays the power usage of the cluster.
cluster_dashboard_deployment_description: Displays the total number of deployments in the cluster.
cluster_dashboard_pod_description: Displays the total number of pods in the cluster by status.
cluster_dashboard_cpu_description: Displays the current CPU usage and requested CPU resources as a percentage of total allocatable CPU.
cluster_dashboard_memory_description: Displays the current memory usage and requested memory resources as a percentage of total allocatable memory.
cluster_dashboard_gpu_memory_description: Displays the current GPU memory usage and requested GPU memory resources as a percentage of total allocatable GPU memory.
cluster_dashboard_gpu_utilization_descri: Displays the current GPU utilization as a percentage of total available GPU resources.
